Description: ASTRA: Alexander Barlet, who was assassinated in Donetsk for complaining about the torture of commanders, lost a kidney. The head of the 6th commandant's office of Donetsk tortured the illegally mobilized father of 4 children, Alexander Barlet, said victim. After complaints about torture, they tried to kill the hero of ASTRA publicationsFather of 4 children Alexander Barlet, illegally mobilized (after voluntary service), past torture cellar and survivor attempt on December 30 in Donetsk, told ASTRA who participated in the torture and attempted murder. After receiving severe injuries, having lost a kidney and regaining consciousness, Barlet told ASTRA that he was beaten in the sixth commandant‚Äôs office of military unit 53435 (former military unit 08826) in Donetsk by the head of the department, Lieutenant Colonel Andrey Redko (call sign -David-). -Personally, he beat Redko in his office, tried to tear up my Russian Federation passport, shouted that I was unworthy to be a citizen of the Russian Federation, and cut my hand with a knife,- Barlet told ASTRA. Human rights activist Maxim Davydov told ASTRA that Redko served in the same military unit as Barlet (42600, former 08826), where Igor Puzik (call sign -Evil-) also worked, who in 2024 year sent soldiers of the DPR long-range reconnaissance regiment on an assault, where they died. Davydov claims that on the day of the attempted murder of Barlet, two people from the 110th brigade (formerly the 100th brigade) of the military unit of Barlet and 4 people from the rapid reaction group of the 6th commandant‚Äôs office of Redko came for him, who opened fire on the man. Davydov says they tried to kill Barlet because he was the victim of a fraudulent scheme - As ASTRA previously wrote, in December it turned out that the man was still assigned to his old military unit 42600, although he no longer served there and was released on leave due to injury. It turned out that at the same time in the military unit he was included in the list of those who left the unit without permission (SOCH), but still allegedly received a salary and payments for injury. However, in the personal account of the Russian Ministry of Defense, unknown details of a bank account were noted, which belongs neither to Barlet nor his family - none of them received the money. When this information was revealed, the military unit tried to cover their tracks by capturing or killing the main witness. -The commanders of the military unit falsified documents that he [Barlet] was still serving, and issued some kind of bank card through which he allegedly received payments, and I think for his injury. And when he began to figure out why he was in the SOC and hired a lawyer, it turned out that Barlet was still listed in the unit as receiving money and fighting. And here all the military investigators are in one gang, along with war criminals from military units, and they simply decided to resolve the matter quietly - to remove the main witness. So they arrived and started shooting. They had the task of taking him at any cost, either alive or dead. I think that even if they had taken him alive, he would not have lasted long at the front,- Davydov tells ASTRA. After Barlet's escape, military unit employees were able to find him and his father at the man's property thanks to bribery of neighbors - Davydov claims that the military paid 10,000 rubles so that Barlet's neighbors would inform him when he would appear at home. This is what happened on the day of the assassination attempt, the human rights activist believes.During the Russian invasion of Ukraine in 2014, Andrei Redko, being a Kramatorsk police operative, was kidnapped by pro-Russian forces, but was later released, the Ukrainian Interior Ministry reported. At the same time, Redko is listed in list of -traitors to Ukraine,- like almost all employees of the 6th commandant‚Äôs office of Donetsk. Redko did not answer ASTRA's call. Ignoring the law threatens blocking and a ban on advertising.-The year 2024 passed for Russian media and journalists under the auspices of the ongoing tightening of legislation, an increase in the number of criminal cases and fines, and the addition of registers of foreign agents and undesirable organizations. Description: An employee of the military prosecutor's office was arrested for organizing the escape of soldiers from the warAccording to -Kommersant-, a military employee The prosecutor's office, who acted as the state prosecutor in cases of military personnel, was arrested for helping deserters escape. The investigation is being supervised by the Main Military Prosecutor's Office.Lieutenant Colonel of Justice Alexey Akhrameshin was detained in a unit of the Central Military District, from where he was assigned to the prosecutor's office of the Joint Group of Forces. In Moscow, he was charged under Article 290 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (taking a bribe), and the 235th Garrison Military Court chose a preventive measure in the form of two months of arrest.The investigation claims that Akhrameshin received 200 thousand rubles for the removal of a native of Sochi who decided to desert. The fugitive was included in the travel application under the pretext of participating in the trial as a witness. When checking the car, the prosecutor gave the password, avoiding inspection. After that, he delivered the deserter to Rostov-on-Don, where his relatives picked him up.

Description: 49 people became infected with hepatitis B and C in the Kamchatka cancer clinic due to the negligence of medical workersAccording to the Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky court, from November 2023 to December 2024, 49 cases of infection: 36 of them an acute form of the disease was diagnosed, and a chronic form of the disease. It is alleged that all those infected underwent a computed tomography (CT) scan with contrast. The information was confirmed by the head of the regional Ministry of Health, Alexander Gashkov (on video).After the outbreak, experts from Moscow were brought in to conduct an epidemiological investigation. They found that the infection spread due to violations of sanitary standards - lack of antiseptics, improper handling of equipment and the use of multi-dose bottles of saline solution. In addition, the virus can be transmitted to patients due to the fact that staff did not clean their hands and used disposable instruments several times.There may be more people infected, since about 1,000 people had MRIs with contrast in the office. Now the work of the CT room has been suspended for a month. The Investigative Committee in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky opened a criminal case on the fact of criminal negligence of unidentified employees of the Kamchatka Regional Oncology Dispensary, which negligently resulted in the infliction of grievous harm to human health (Part 2 of Article 293 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation). The pensioner ran to another carriage, but the train had already started moving, and the conductor closed the door literally in front of her.-In response to her pleas to break the stop valve and let her out, she replied that it was her own fault, she went into the wrong vestibule, but The stop valve will not be pulled off, because literally -they will deprive the bonus, but the salary is only 30 thousand!-, - told by the woman's daughter. As a result, the pensioner was dropped off at the next station in the forest. -There is forest all around, complete darkness, not a single lamp nearby, no houses visible. Frost about 20 degrees. I saw some path, thought that it led to housing and walked along it. Then it turned out that this path led into the forest to the -Path of Health- and went in the other direction from the house! But in the darkness it was impossible to make out anything. Then, finally, I was able to reach her by phone. that she left in Lebyazhka and got lost in the forest and that‚Äôs it, the connection was lost! More than two hours!-writes the victim‚Äôs daughter. Lebyazhka is located 3 km from the railway line. As a result, the woman reached the nearest houses by the barking of dogs. Her relatives took her from there. The Barnaul Transport Prosecutor's Office will check information about -inadequate provision of services,- the department said.

Description: The State Duma proposed to take into account the grade in history when entering a universityState Duma Deputy Alexander Aksenenko proposed including the grade in history from the school certificate in the results that are taken into account when entering universities, RIA reports -News-.In an address to Deputy Prime Minister of the Russian Federation Dmitry Chernyshenko, he noted that only 12% of Russian graduates pass the Unified State Exam in history, and this, according to Aksenenko, indicates poor knowledge of 88% of young people in this subject.Aksenenko emphasized the importance of studying the history of Russia, especially the latest, and proposed making an assessment in this subject mandatory for admission to higher educational institutions, so that raise the status of history in school education and bring back the competition for certificates, which disappeared with the introduction of the Unified State Exam.At the same time, preparation for the Unified State Exam, the deputy believes, does not leave schoolchildren time to study other important subjects, which affects the general level of knowledge.In 2023, the Unified State Examination in History there werequestions about the war in Ukraine, and in 2025 in questions of the Unified State Exam in History the names of participants in the war in Ukraine may appear.Earlier ASTRA wrote that Russian schoolchildren as part of their lessons will study Putin's interview with Tucker Carlson, and from school manuals for Victory Day removed mention of the contribution of Ukrainians to the fight against fascism. üí•Send photo/video/information: @redastrabotüí• ASTRA publication website in English and Russian: https://astra.press(opens with VPN in Russia)
